creator: PS118
title: A FREE Multimeter Workstation!
description: This project is a multimeter workstation built from upcycled materials to hold and organize multimeters, making them easily accessible for electronics projects. It includes features like probe storage, a carrying handle, and the ability to be wall-mounted at an angle for better LCD readability.
steps: Cut a piece of chipboard to 7 inches wide and to a height that accommodates the multimeters plus a lip.
Cut two legs, each 3/4 inch wide and the same height as the board.
Attach the legs to the board using grabber screws at the pivot point.
Drill a hole near the top of the legs and attach a length of scrap cat-5 wire between them to create a carrying handle and wall hanger.
Drill holes for the probes on the top and front of the board, positioned 1/4 and 3/4 inch in from both sides.
Attach the multimeters to the board using self-adhesive velcro dots.
Label one meter 'V' (volts) and the other 'A' (amps).
